summary: <summary> <purpose>The pathUtils.ts file provides a utility class, PathUtils, that contains a set of static methods for working with file paths in a Node.js environment. It offers functionality to normalize, get relative and absolute paths, validate paths, and extract file information such as extensions and base names.</purpose> <key_components> - PathUtils class - normalize(filepath: string): string - getRelativePath(filepath: string, rootDir: string): string - getAbsolutePath(filepath: string, rootDir: string): string - validatePath(filepath: string): boolean - getExtension(filepath: string): string - getBaseName(filepath: string): string - join(...paths: string[]): string - createDisplayPath(filepath: string, maxLength?: number): string </key_components> <dependencies> - path (built-in Node.js module) - fs (built-in Node.js module) - customErrors (FileSystemError) </dependencies> <unique_characteristics> - Provides a centralized set of path-related utility functions - Handles path normalization, relative/absolute path resolution, and path validation - Includes methods to extract file extensions, base names, and create truncated display paths - Leverages built-in Node.js modules (path, fs) and a custom FileSystemError </unique_characteristics> <methods> - normalize - getRelativePath - getAbsolutePath - validatePath - getExtension - getBaseName - join - createDisplayPath </methods> <exports if any> - PathUtils class </exports if any> </summary>
